meaning: capable of; worthy of; suitable for; tending to
explanation: The suffix "-able" is used to form adjectives, often from verbs. It signifies that something **có thể** được thực hiện, **đáng để** được làm, hoặc **phù hợp để** làm một điều gì đó. It frequently implies possibility or suitability.
level_note: Words with '-able' are common across B1-C1 CEFR levels, depending on the base word.

parts.meaning: sự thoải mái, an ủi (ease, solace)
có thể, có khả năng (capable of, suitable for)

words.logic: Khi 'comfort' (sự thoải mái) kết hợp với '-able' (có khả năng, phù hợp), nó tạo thành 'comfortable' mang ý nghĩa 'có khả năng mang lại sự thoải mái' hoặc 'cảm thấy thoải mái'.
words.meaning_en: providing physical ease and relaxation; feeling relaxed
words.example: I always feel comfortable in my new bed.

collocations.example: Do you feel comfortable talking about it?
She always wears comfortable shoes for walking.
Please sit down and make yourself comfortable.

forms.example: The hotel offers great comfort to its guests.
She tried to comfort the crying child.
I felt uncomfortable in the crowded room.

parts.meaning: có thể, có khả năng (capable of)

words.logic: Gốc 'understand' (hiểu) kết hợp với '-able' (có thể) tạo thành 'understandable', nghĩa là 'có thể hiểu được' hoặc 'dễ hiểu'.
words.meaning_vi: dễ hiểu, có thể hiểu được
words.example: Her reasons for being upset were completely understandable.

collocations.example: It's perfectly understandable that you're nervous.
Their decision to leave was completely understandable.

forms.example: I don't understand what you mean.
We need to reach a mutual understanding.

parts.meaning: thưởng thức, tận hưởng (take pleasure in)
có thể, đáng để (capable of, worthy of)

words.logic: Từ 'enjoy' (thưởng thức) kết hợp với '-able' (có thể, đáng để) tạo thành 'enjoyable', mang ý nghĩa 'có thể/đáng để thưởng thức', tức là 'thú vị, mang lại niềm vui'.
words.example: We had a very enjoyable evening at the concert.

collocations.example: The movie was highly enjoyable from start to finish.
Learning new things is often an enjoyable experience.
The teacher always tries to make lessons enjoyable for students.

forms.example: I really enjoy reading historical novels.
He gets a lot of enjoyment from gardening.
The long wait made the trip unenjoyable.

parts.meaning: dựa vào, tin cậy (depend on, trust)
có thể, đáng để (capable of, worthy of)

words.logic: Gốc 'rely' (tin cậy) kết hợp với '-able' (có thể, đáng để) tạo thành 'reliable', mang ý nghĩa 'có thể/đáng để tin cậy được'.
words.meaning_en: able to be relied on; dependable
words.example: We need a reliable car for our long journeys.

collocations.example: Always check information from a reliable source.
This report provides reliable information on the market.
Our new system is highly reliable and rarely fails.

forms.example: You can rely on me to help you.
The reliability of the data is crucial for our research.
The old clock is very unreliable.

parts.meaning: có thể, có khả năng (capable of)

words.logic: Từ 'sustain' (duy trì) kết hợp với '-able' (có thể) tạo thành 'sustainable', nghĩa là 'có thể duy trì được lâu dài mà không gây hại', đặc biệt trong ngữ cảnh môi trường và phát triển.
words.meaning_vi: bền vững, có thể duy trì được
words.meaning_en: able to be maintained at a certain rate or level; causing little or no damage to the environment and therefore able to continue for a long time
words.example: The company is committed to sustainable development.

collocations.example: Sustainable development aims to meet the needs of the present without compromising the future.
Solar power is a form of sustainable energy.
They are focused on achieving sustainable growth for the business.

forms.example: The bridge is designed to sustain heavy loads.
Environmental sustainability is a global challenge.
The current rate of consumption is unsustainable.
